vmassol - (08:03): good morning  
vmassol - (08:03): mflorea: I'm implementing generic support in Link (with get/setParameters) + types classes fro document and interwiki links  
mflorea - (08:05): vmassol: good morning. ok, I'll wait for you to commit and then I'll fix the WYSIWYG  
mflorea - (08:05): "wait" = do something else  
vmassol - (08:06): :)

sburjan - (09:01): sdumitriu: ping  
silviar left at 09:10 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:11  
silviar1 joined #xwiki at 09:12  
silviar left at 09:16 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:23  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:26  
sburjan - (09:30): guys .. I have a question. I see that in XWiki space (which holds the administration application pages) are certain pages thatare not exposed. eg. XWikiSyntax. Why ?  
vmassol - (09:32): tmortagne: almost done re my refactoring for Links. Finishing the rebuild to verify it all work  
vmassol - (09:32): who's doing the release? sergiu?  
vmassol - (09:32): jvdrean: are you ready for the user directory?  
vmassol - (09:33): what else are we missing for this M2 release?  
tmortagne - (09:33): vmassol: yep sdumitriu  
vmassol - (09:33): sdumitriu: when do you plan to start the release?  
vmassol - (09:34): (we shouldn't move it again IMO, just release what we have and too bad for those who're not ready - We'll then decide whether to include the rest of the changes in RC1 or not). I propose to start the release at 14:00 Paris time if that's ok with you sergiu. Which means ensuring all tests pass before then  
vmassol - (09:34): wdyt?  
vmassol - (09:35): I know Marius needs to fix the wysiwyg after my changes in link handling but that can be done this morning. I can help him.  
sburjan - (09:35): vmassol: I am testing as we speak  
vmassol - (09:35): sburjan: ok  
vmassol - (09:35): cool  
sburjan - (09:35): but could you answer my question please ? :)  
vmassol - (09:36): (minor bugs can be fixed in RC1)  
vmassol - (09:36): sburjan: exposed=?  
vmassol - (09:36): visible?  
vmassol - (09:36): with what user?  
sburjan - (09:36): I mean.. they are not linked .. that page is accessed via document index of that space.  
sburjan - (09:36): with Administrator  
vmassol - (09:36): they are  
vmassol - (09:36): XWikiSyntax is linked in the page editing and in the features home  
vmassol - (09:37): (unless silvia or you changed it….)  
vmassol - (09:37): ;)  
sburjan - (09:39): I am unable to find something that links to that page  
vmassol - (09:39): sburjan: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#Information  
vmassol - (09:39): linked from 7 places  
sburjan - (09:40): I'm testing the latest snapshot on local. I see a link from the sandbox page  
vmassol - (09:41): you're talking about XE or xwiki.org?  
sburjan - (09:42): XW  
sburjan - (09:42): \*XE  
sburjan - (09:42): testing before the release  
vmassol - (09:42): the XWikiSyntax page is supposed to be linked from the edit mode in the Help panel  
vmassol - (09:42): now maybe someone removed that panel and didn't have a help back  
vmassol - (09:42): that would be bad  
vmassol - (09:43): tmortagne: now working to remove all (DocumentLink) casts....  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 09:44  
sdumitriu left at 09:45 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds  
sburjan - (09:45): vmassol: I can't find the Help panel.  
vmassol - (09:45): sburjan: then someone removed it, you should ask sergiu, I guess he's the one who's remove it. You could check mailing list history too maybe  
vmassol - (09:46): I remember some discussion to add a help button in the editors  
vmassol - (09:46): have you checked the editors?  
sburjan - (09:46): wdym by editors ?  
sburjan - (09:47): oh .. yes.. it's there  
sburjan - (09:47): when editing  
silviar1 - (09:47): "XWIKI SYNTAX HELP" panel  
silviar1 - (09:48): in wiki & wysiwyg editing modes  
sburjan - (09:49): yes  
silviar1 - (09:49): under "Document Information"  
silviar1 - (09:49): ok  
sburjan - (09:49): ;)  
silviar1 - (09:49): :)  
sburjan - (09:49): I also found a small inconsistency in "Rename a page" Page  
sburjan - (09:49): waiting for  sergiu to become online  
sburjan - (09:52): although .. odd thing is  that XWiki Syntax Help panel doesn't appear in the Panel List (the whole list from where you can drag and drop)

vmassol - (10:15): build is failing on rest  
vmassol - (10:15): so I cannot test my changes, committing what I have…. :(  
vmassol - (10:17): mflorea: it's all ready for you  
mflorea - (10:17): vmassol: I'm on it  
vmassol - (10:17): ok  
vmassol - (10:29): fixing build  
vmassol - (10:29): found why it's failing in rest  
vmassol - (10:30): fixed  
mflorea - (10:31): vmassol: so I still need to use the concrete DocumentLink type even if I don't set any custom parameters?  
vmassol - (10:31): mflorea: no  
vmassol - (10:31): you can use Link  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:31  
vmassol - (10:31): DocumentLink and InterWiki Link are just helpers now  
vmassol - (10:31): (providing typed apis)  
mflorea - (10:32): hmm, maybe I haven't updated all the jars  
vmassol - (10:32): do a svn up  
vmassol - (10:32): I committed twice  
mflorea - (10:32): ah, right, I don't have the second commit  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:40  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:46  
lpereira joined #xwiki at 11:04  
jvdrean - (11:08): quick poll, what do you prefer for user matching:  
jvdrean - (11:08): 1) UserCriteria#setNameFilter(String filter), UserCriteria#setFilter(String prop, String filter) ?  
jvdrean - (11:08): 2) UserNameFilter (implements UserFilter), UserNameFilter.matches(User user). The velocity bridge would provide factories for the available filters.  
jvdrean - (11:08): I know it's late but while I'm at it I can implement the 2nd now  
vmassol - (11:09): jvdrean:  
vmassol - (11:09): I didn't see your reply this morning  
vmassol - (11:10): "jvdrean: are you ready for the user directory?"  
tmortagne - (11:10): seems not ;)  
vmassol - (11:10): jvdrean: ok, that's not very good, it means we won't have user dir in 2.5M2 and maybe not in 2.5  
jvdrean - (11:11): missed your message, indeed I'm not ready, we've started to debate for real about the API when I was ready to commit  
tmortagne - (11:11): jvdrean: problem with UserFilter is that you can't filter in the query, you force the implementation to query all the users and then use the filter on each one  
tmortagne - (11:11): seems very bad to me  
vmassol - (11:11): jvdrean: you're mixing stuff  
jvdrean left #xwiki at 11:11  
vmassol - (11:11): the user api and the user dir  
vmassol - (11:11): they're two different things  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 11:11  
vmassol - (11:12): and the user api should of course not be discussed close to release and certianzly not block the user dir  
vmassol - (11:12): jvdrean: just to be sure, you're saying you won't be able to commit the user dir before 14:00 today?  
jvdrean - (11:12): vmassol: yes, the user dir is a secondary target  
vmassol - (11:12): (commit = commit + test)  
vmassol - (11:13): jvdrean: no it's the opposite  
vmassol - (11:13): check the roadmap for 2.5  
jvdrean - (11:13): vmassol: let's not discuss about this here  
vmassol - (11:13): there's no user module defined in there only a user dir  
vmassol - (11:13): well it's important to disscuss here because we need to release  
jvdrean - (11:15): I can commit an old fashioned user directory before 2pm  
jvdrean - (11:16): and refactor it if we have an agreement about the users API later  
vmassol - (11:16): sounds good, but it has to work and be tested a minimum  
vmassol - (11:16): are you talking about Raluca's version?  
jvdrean - (11:18): actually I was thinking about what I currently have, with the json service using the old API  
mflorea - (11:19): vmassol: when serializing an attachment link reference I don't get the "attach:" prefix. I guess I have to add it, right?  
mflorea - (11:20): in other words, "attach:" is or not part of the attachment link reference?  
mflorea - (11:22): I am referring to [[Label>>attach:Space.Page@file]]  
jvdrean - (11:23): vmassol: any preference for the user dir. page name ? where should it be linked from ?  
mflorea - (11:23): I'm creating a new Link object, set its type to LinkType.ATTACHMENT and then set its reference to "Space.Page@file". The LinkReferenceSerializer returns "Space.Page@file"  
vmassol - (11:24): mflorea: no you shouldn't, let me check  
vmassol - (11:35): tmortagne: I'm getting lots of warnings when I start XE  
vmassol - (11:35): (on trunk)  
vmassol - (11:36): of this type:  
vmassol - (11:36): 2010-09-30 11:35:42,708 [main] WARN  tion.ComponentAnnotationLoader  - Component [org.xwiki.rest.resources.RootResource] is being overwritten by component [org.xwiki.rest.resources.RootResource] for Role/Hint [role = [org.xwiki.rest.XWikiRestComponent] hint = [org.xwiki.rest.resources.RootResource]]. It will not be possible to look it up.  
vmassol - (11:36): 2010-09-30 11:35:42,710 [main] WARN  tion.ComponentAnnotationLoader  - Component [org.xwiki.rest.resources.SyntaxesResource] is being overwritten by component [org.xwiki.rest.resources.SyntaxesResource] for Role/Hint [role = [org.xwiki.rest.XWikiRestComponent] hint = [org.xwiki.rest.resources.SyntaxesResource]]. It will not be possible to look it up.  
tmortagne - (11:37): vmassol: maybe Fabio forgot something in his refactoring  
tmortagne - (11:37): like having the old and the new server jar distributed  
vmassol - (11:37): hmm indeed  
vmassol - (11:37): it's only rest components  
tmortagne - (11:38): checking hudson  
tmortagne - (11:39): doe snot seems in a very good shape  
tmortagne - (11:39): or it's my DNS issues again  
fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 11:39  
fmancinelli - (11:39): Hi everybody  
vmassol - (11:39): hi fabio  
fmancinelli - (11:40): Vincent told me that there are issues with the REST refactoring  
vmassol - (11:40): the pb is when I start XE I get lots of warnings about REST components  
vmassol - (11:40): of this type:  
vmassol - (11:40): 11:36  
vmassol - (11:40): 2010-09-30 11:35:42,708 [main] WARN  tion.ComponentAnnotationLoader  - Component [org.xwiki.rest.resources.RootResource] is being overwritten by component [org.xwiki.rest.resources.RootResource] for Role/Hint [role = [org.xwiki.rest.XWikiRestComponent] hint = [org.xwiki.rest.resources.RootResource]]. It will not be possible to look it up.  
vmassol - (11:40): 2010-09-30 11:35:42,710 [main] WARN  tion.ComponentAnnotationLoader  - Component [org.xwiki.rest.resources.SyntaxesResource] is being overwritten by component [org.xwiki.rest.resources.SyntaxesResource] for Role/Hint [role = [org.xwiki.rest.XWikiRestComponent] hint = [org.xwiki.rest.resources.SyntaxesResource]]. It will not be possible to look it up.  
vmassol - (11:40): seems like you're registering REST components several times  
tmortagne - (11:40): could be that for some reason XE distribution contains the old and the new server jar probably  
tmortagne - (11:40): vmassol: could you check what you have ?  
tmortagne - (11:41): you should have xwiki-rest-server and xwiki-rest-model  
vmassol - (11:41): [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) $ ls -l webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/\*rest\*  
vmassol - (11:41): -rw-r--r--@ 1 vmassol  staff  205486 Jun 14 18:28 webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/com.noelios.restlet-1.1.4.jar  
vmassol - (11:41): -rw-r--r--@ 1 vmassol  staff   19113 Jun 14 18:28 webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/com.noelios.restlet.ext.servlet-1.1.4.jar  
vmassol - (11:41): -rw-r--r--@ 1 vmassol  staff  248736 Jun 14 18:28 webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/org.restlet-1.1.4.jar  
vmassol - (11:41): -rw-r--r--@ 1 vmassol  staff  286103 Jun 14 18:28 webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/org.restlet.ext.jaxrs-1.1.4.jar  
vmassol - (11:41): -rw-r--r--@ 1 vmassol  staff   50467 Sep 30 10:40 webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-core-annotations-rest-2.5-SNAPSHOT.jar  
vmassol - (11:41): -rw-r--r--@ 1 vmassol  staff  168829 Sep 30 09:29 webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-rest-2.5-SNAPSHOT.jar  
tmortagne - (11:41): if you have xwiki-rest jar that's the issue  
vmassol - (11:41): -rw-r--r--@ 1 vmassol  staff   63552 Sep 30 09:29 webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-rest-model-2.5-SNAPSHOT.jar  
vmassol - (11:41): -rw-r--r--@ 1 vmassol  staff  168488 Sep 30 10:39 webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-rest-server-2.5-SNAPSHOT.jar  
fmancinelli - (11:41): Yesterday, before committing, I checked the build that is unpacked in /target in distribution-tests/rest-tests and it was ok.  
tmortagne - (11:41): xwiki-rest-2.5-SNAPSHOT.jar  
tmortagne - (11:41): yep that's it  
vmassol - (11:42): I just did a clean rebuild and it's there  
tmortagne - (11:42): so there is still some mixing  
fmancinelli - (11:42): did you svnup enterprise?  
tmortagne - (11:42): vmassol: are you fully updated ?  
vmassol - (11:42): yes  
vmassol - (11:43): yes  
vmassol - (11:45): I see:  
vmassol - (11:45): ./web/standard/pom.xml:      <artifactId>xwiki-rest</artifactId>  
vmassol - (11:45):     <!-- The REST module -->  
vmassol - (11:45):     <dependency>  
vmassol - (11:45):       <groupId>com.xpn.xwiki.platform</groupId>  
vmassol - (11:45):       <artifactId>xwiki-rest</artifactId>  
vmassol - (11:45):       <version>${platform.core.version}</version>  
vmassol - (11:45):     </dependency>  
vmassol - (11:46): fmancinelli: can you fix it?  
tmortagne1 joined #xwiki at 11:47  
fmancinelli - (11:47): s\*\*t I forgot to commit it yesterday :(  
fmancinelli - (11:47): sorry  
vmassol - (11:48): so this warning is pretty cool actually :)  
fmancinelli - (11:48): done  
tmortagne1 - (11:48): the release would not have worked anyway  
vmassol - (11:49): on a side note I find my local XE quite slow compared to before, not sure if it's just a feeling or not  
tmortagne left at 11:49 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
vmassol - (11:49): it's definitely very slow here  
vmassol - (11:50): takes a lot longer than before to load a page  
vmassol - (11:51): tmortagne1: found a pb. There's now an ExtensionManager space  
vmassol - (11:51): which is visible by everyone  
tmortagne1 - (11:51): vmassol: that's extension manager app  
vmassol - (11:51): I know what it is  
vmassol - (11:52): could we move it to XWiki space for now?  
vmassol - (11:52): it's just one page  
vmassol - (11:52): and it shouldn't be visible by everyopne  
vmassol - (11:52): we can decide later on to create a new space for it if need be  
tmortagne1 - (11:53): yes  
vmassol - (11:54): tmortagne1: missing some translation resource for admin.extensions in the admin page  
tmortagne1 - (11:56): where ?  
vmassol - (11:56): http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Extensions  
tmortagne1 - (11:56): it's an error, it's not supposed to be in admin already  
tmortagne1 - (11:56): i need to remove that  
vmassol - (11:56): ah I thought it was cool to be there  
vmassol - (11:56): :)  
tmortagne1 - (11:57): yes bt not yet  
tmortagne1 - (11:57): since it's experimental  
vmassol - (11:57): there's a message  
vmassol - (11:57): saying it's experimental  
tmortagne1 - (11:57): sure but it appear with others important admin sections so i'm not sure  
vmassol - (11:58): I think it's ok. We could add experimental in the icon title though  
vmassol - (11:58): or a differnet icon  
mflorea - (11:58): vmassol: any news regarding the attachment link reference? who's responsible for adding the "attach:" prefix?  
vmassol - (11:58): with experimental across the image  
tmortagne1 - (11:58): vmassol: yes a special icon would be nice  
vmassol - (11:58): mflorea: oops sorry I forgot it, looking  
mflorea - (11:58): np :)  
vmassol - (11:59): mflorea: actually I was waiting for my IDE to refresh but it's not finishing, it looks dead, will restart  
mflorea - (11:59): :(  
vmassol - (11:59): maybe that's why my local XE looks sluggish....  
tmortagne1 - (12:05): vmassol: page moved, waiting for Ciprian to do a quick image for admin  
vmassol - (12:06): ok  
vmassol - (12:10): mflorea: I see that DefaultLinkTypeReferenceSerializer is printing the scheme  
vmassol - (12:10): are you manually constructing a Link object for an attachment?  
vmassol - (12:10): if so are you calling the isTyped() method?  
vmassol - (12:12): I could force the serialization to always consider attachment links to be typed but then other portion of code will not behave properly either if the Link is not constructed properly so IMO it's more a constructor issue  
vmassol - (12:16): I guess I could inroduce the notion of "non-typed allowed" in LinkType so that when you set the type it calls isTyped for link types that don't support non-typed…. hmmm  
vmassol - (12:17): this isTyped thing is a bit of a pain but that's the only way we have to remember what the user has entered and not normalize the link  
vmassol - (12:18): actually maybe isTyped should be true by default  
vmassol - (12:18): since that's the canoncail way of representing a link reference  
tmortagne1 - (12:18): vmassol: +1 for true by default  
vmassol - (12:20): ok fixing this  
vmassol - (12:24): mflorea: which means when we say new DocumentLink() it's going to be  a typed link by default  
Enygma` left at 12:33 (Quit: Leaving.  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 12:39  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 12:43  
Enygma` left at 12:43 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds

sdumitriu - (12:46): Good morning  
sdumitriu - (12:46): vmassol: Yep, I'll start the release soon  
vmassol - (12:48): sdumitriu: I'll do a last commit in about 5 minutes  
vmassol - (12:48): sdumitriu: is 14:00 GMT+1 ok to start the release?  
sdumitriu - (12:50): Just sent a vote  
jvdrean - (12:52): I've applied Raluca's patches locally with minor modifications, now rebuilding everything to test it  
silviar left at 12:53 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (12:56): mflorea: done, you shouldn't need to call isTyped(true) now  
vmassol - (12:57): (assuming that was your problem)  
vmassol - (13:08): fyi I'm off this afternoon (it's my wife's birthday and I'm taking her out… ). Sorry I won't be able to help for the release  
sdumitriu - (13:08): No problem  
sdumitriu - (13:09): Have fun  
vmassol - (13:09): I would have liked to finish with marius this morning but he seems offline right now  
mflorea - (13:09): vmassol: back from lunch. let me check  
vmassol - (13:09): ok thanks mflorea, I have to go in 1 hour  
vmassol - (13:09): in the meantime I'm avail  
sburjan left at 13:13 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
jvdrean - (13:14): what did I forget to build to get this ?  
jvdrean - (13:14): Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: XWIKI\_2\_1  
jvdrean - (13:14): at org.xwiki.rendering.internal.renderer.xwiki21.XWikiSyntaxRendererFactory.getSyntax(XWikiSyntaxRendererFactory.java:41)  
vmassol - (13:15): rendering module  
vmassol - (13:15): but it should be built by hudson  
jvdrean - (13:18): I have duplicate jars in my distrib, I must have forgot a clean somewhere  
jvdrean - (13:19): (duplicate as in from hudson + local snapshots)  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 13:26  
vmassol - (13:29): sdumitriu: fyi I have upgraded the javadoc plugin to version 2.7 in the top level pom. I don't recall exactly the problem but we had issues in the past when doing a release with the javadoc plugin. In case you have a problem you might want to roll it back to the earlier version.  
sdumitriu - (13:30): K  
tmortagne1 - (13:30): vmassol: looks like you did not seen my comment in pom.xml file  
tmortagne1 - (13:30): "<!-- Still not fixed in 2.7 it seems... -->"  
tmortagne1 - (13:31): i already tested with 2.7 some times ago  
vmassol - (13:32): I did too which is why I put that line  
vmassol - (13:32): but now I couldn't find the pb again  
vmassol - (13:32): and I get the same error with 2.5 too  
vmassol - (13:32): s/Error/warning/  
tmortagne1 - (13:33): vmassol: all i know is that it doe snot work with 2.7 and it's working well with 2.5 for me when i release so it's useless to try again with 2.7 IMO  
vmassol - (13:33): doe not work = ?  
vmassol - (13:33): mvn site was working for me  
tmortagne1 - (13:34): it's the exact same issue that with 1.6.x  
tmortagne1 - (13:34): what mvn site has to do with it ?  
vmassol - (13:34): (I had problems with 2.5 with mvn site though)  
tmortagne1 - (13:34): i'm talking about javadoc  
vmassol - (13:34): yes javadoc are generated by the site too  
tmortagne1 - (13:34): we don't release with site  
vmassol - (13:35): it may also dpeend on the maven version used maybe  
tmortagne1 - (13:35): mainly because we have never been able to make it work properly  
tmortagne1 - (13:36): the issue with javadoc plugin only appear in release:perform AFAIK  
vmassol - (13:36): I still get these but it's working:  
vmassol - (13:36): [INFO] Generating "JavaDocs" report.  
vmassol - (13:36): [INFO] The goal 'org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-javadoc-plugin:2.7:javadoc' has not be previously called for the project: 'org.xwiki.platform.tools:xwiki-license-resources:jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT'. Trying to invoke it...

mflorea - (13:56): hmm, the query string is taken from the link URL. If I edit the link URL with Firebug and remove the query string then I get only [[Label>>Space.Page]]. I thought link URL is ignored, only link meta data is used  
mflorea - (14:00): note that the link URL is generated by the rendering. To reproduce, just put [[Label>>NewSpace.NewPage]] in a wiki page then edit and save in WYSIWYG mode. The wiki syntax becomes: [[Label>>NewSpace.NewPage?parent=HostSpace.HostPage]]  
mflorea - (14:03): Indeed, the rendering takes the query string from the link URL, because [[Label>>Space.Page?abc=123]] generates <!--startwikilink:Space.Page--> (so the query string is not part of the link meta data)  
mflorea - (14:05): so the problem is that the rendering is generating some query string parameters that are not in the source wiki syntax and then these parameters are persisted

mflorea - (15:12): tmortagne1: here's what happens: the user enters  
mflorea - (15:12): a.b@c?d=e&f=g#h  
mflorea - (15:12): as the page name. The editor sends this to the server which parses it as a document reference:  
mflorea - (15:12): name = [a.b@c?d=e&f=g#h]  
mflorea - (15:12): then it serializes it  
mflorea - (15:12): a\.b@c?d=e&f=g#h  
mflorea - (15:12): in order to create a link reference (using LinkReferenceSerializer):  
mflorea - (15:12): doc:a\.b@c?d=e&f=g#h  
mflorea - (15:12): which is then returned to the client. The editor creates this link meta data:  
mflorea - (15:12): <!--startwikilink:doc:a\\.b@c?d=e&f=g#h-->  
mflorea - (15:12): which is then converted to (when the page is saved)  
mflorea - (15:12): [[label>>a\.b\@c\?d=e&f=g\#h]]  
mflorea - (15:12): Does it make sense?  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 15:13

mflorea - (15:14): yes

tmortagne1 - (15:14): in 2.1 that would not be right  
mflorea - (15:15): <!--startwikilink:doc:a\\.b@c?d=e&f=g#h-->  
mflorea - (15:15): is converted to xwiki/2.0  
tmortagne1 - (15:15): 2.0: [[label>>a\.b\@c\?d=e&f=g\#h]]

tmortagne1 - (17:46): the snippet unhide the hidden document

tmortagne1 - (17:47): well that's because you don't have a main space in this space  
tmortagne1 - (17:47): you can use the AllDocs UI

tmortagne1 - (17:51): if not you can directly go to Main/AllDocs page
